page.title: 01 Countryside SE of New Deer
page.content: { }This area, to the south of New Deer village, is entirely made up of {agricultural land, most of which is {intensively managed. There are pockets of uncultivated land in the area, mostly{small areas {of wetland or peatbog,}and also some {small plantations of sitka spruce. In recent years almost all the {unoccupied farmhouses in the area have {been renovated}and often occupied by {non-farming residents.}The{farms}in the area{have become larger by {amalgamation}and the number of people working directly on the land has decreased due to{mechanisation. As a result of the above changes the local population has not reduced but has changed in character. DATA and TEXT compiled by members of NEW DEER COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION and children from the area(Ed.A.H.Smith)
